channel.title: RSS Aggregator Feed
channel.description: An aggregated feed of Technology-related news

item.title: Reddit’s CEO says r/popular ‘sucks,’ and it’s going away
item.description: Reddit is “moving away” from r/popular, the default feed for new users, and plans to replace it with “better, more relevant and personalized feeds,” according to CEO Steve Huffman (aka Spez). Huffman also notes that r/popular “sucks.” “For a long while, we were known as the ‘front page of the internet,’ but we’ve outgrown a […]

item.title: Trump embraces gas guzzlers and air pollution by weakening fuel economy standards
item.description: President Donald Trump announced a new plan that lets carmakers pollute more by making less fuel efficient vehicles. The National Highway Traffic Safety Administration (NHTSA) said today that it’ll roll back fuel economy rules finalized last year by the Biden administration for model year 2022-2031 vehicles. The Trump administration has eliminated incentives for EV purchases, […]...

item.title: I tested the world’s first rollable laptop - and the Lenovo ThinkBook Plus Gen 6 Rollable's extendable display changed my understanding of what working on the go really means
item.description: The Lenovo ThinkBook Plus Gen 6 Rollable is a laptop from the future.

item.title: ‘Paranormal Activity’ Just Won’t Stop Coming Back
item.description: James Wan adds to his horror empire by joining the next installment in the spooky found-footage series.

item.title: Uber’s Robotaxi Rolls Out in Dallas With Human Supervision
item.description: Uber will have its targets set on Waymo in 2026.

item.title: Trump administration rolls back fuel economy standards, again
item.description: The regulatory decision would make it harder for future administrations to implement stricter fuel efficiency standards.

item.title: La marque Crucial va disparaitre, les prix de la mémoire vont exploser (encore)
item.description: La chasse à la barrette de RAM pour muscler votre PC gaming va devenir un sport de plus en plus risqué. Un des géants du secteur de la mémoire, Micron, a en effet annoncé que sa marque grand public Curcial allait quitter le marché. L'entreprise veut se concentrer sur les grands comptes — comprenez : le secteur de l'IA.

item.title: WordPress’s vibe-coding experiment, Telex, has already been put to real-world use
item.description: Though WordPress's Telex is still an experiment, the vibe coding software has already been used to help build real-world websites.

item.title: Senators Grill NASA Nominee Over Leaked Plan to Slash Science and Privatize Space
item.description: “I do stand behind everything in the document.”

item.title: The Guy Behind Liquid Glass Is Leaving Apple for Meta
item.description: Is everyone leaving Apple now?

item.title: Watch out - these scam Mac Store apps are impersonating Google Gemini & OpenAI ChatGPT
item.description: Scam apps impersonating Google Gemini and ChatGPT repeatedly appear on the Mac Store, exploiting branding and exposing users to potential security risks.

item.title: VCs deploy ‘kingmaking’ strategy to crown AI winners in their infancy
item.description: While VCs have long used big investments to spur category winners, they are taking this strategy to new extremes.

item.title: The fantastic Breville Barista Express is still at a record-low price after Black Friday
item.description: The Breville Barista Express is a premium coffee machine with a new tasty discount still available after Black Friday.

item.title: Apple’s head of UI design is leaving for Meta
item.description: Alan Dye, who has led Apple’s UI design team since 2015, is leaving to join Meta as its chief design officer, Bloomberg reports. He’ll join Meta on December 31st, and Meta is opening a design studio and giving Dye oversight of design for “hardware, software and AI integration for its interfaces,” according to Bloomberg. Dye […]

item.title: North Korean 'fake worker' scheme caught live on camera
item.description: Researchers trapped Lazarus operators with sandbox environments

item.title: Des astronomes ont retrouvé la trace de deux étoiles qui sont passées près du Système solaire !
item.description: Elles semblent fixes dans notre ciel. Pourtant, toutes les étoiles sont en mouvement. Et deux d’entre elles ont rendu une visite à notre Soleil. C’était il y a plus de 4 millions d’années. Mais les traces sont toujours là…

item.title: Coup de tonnerre chez Apple : le patron du design file chez Meta
item.description: C'est un sacré coup dur pour Apple, qui n'arrive décidément plus à retenir ses talents. La firme à la pomme subit une nouvelle défection majeure avec le départ d'Alan Dye, le patron du design des interfaces. Il rejoint Meta.

item.title: ‘End-to-end encrypted’ smart toilet camera is not actually end-to-end encrypted
item.description: Kohler, the makers of a smart toilet camera, can access customers' data stored on its servers, and can use customers’ bowl pictures to train AI.

item.title: Company backed by Donald Trump Jr.’s firm nabs $620M government contract
item.description: Vulcan Elements, a rare-earth magnets startup, has secured a $620 million contract from the U.S. defense department.

item.title: AWS Nova Forge could be your company's cue to start building custom AI models
item.description: AWS has a host of new AI models, and a brand-new way to build and customize them exactly how you like.

item.title: Google Drive is getting better search, but it will cost you
item.description: Google is looking to improve the searchability on Drive, but there's a catch.

item.title: Last-call on T‑Mobiles Black Friday Apple bundle — get an iPhone, iPad, and Apple Watch for free
item.description: T-Mobile has dropped an Apple bundle that's offering new and existing customers, including businesses, the chance to get the iPhone 17 Pro, iPad (A16), and Apple Watch SE 3 for free.

item.title: Here are my 25 favorite deals from REI’s Cyber Week sale
item.description: REI took a hike during Black Friday, but the retailer is back with a full week of deals. Now through December 8th, REI is hosting a Cyber Week sale that offers big discounts on gadgets and gear designed for the outdoors. If you’re planning to hit the slopes this winter, now’s a good time to […]

item.title: William Shatner’s View of the Prime Directive Is Pure Kirk
item.description: Speaking at a recent 'Star Trek' convention, the star argued that the franchise's most fundamental rule is made to be broken.

item.title: Report: Pete Gets a Pass for Signalgate
item.description: Republicans are already spinning the report as a "nothing burger."

item.title: After NYC implemented congestion pricing, Chicago became America’s worst city for traffic
item.description: A new report from transportation analytics company INRIX shows people are spending more time in their cars in major cities across the country. If you feel like you spent more time sitting in traffic this year than last, you’re not alone.

item.title: I was hoping for Babel Fish realtime audio translation, and while the InnAIO AI Translator T9is impressive, it's not there yet
item.description: This compact device uses a MagSafe connector to attach to your phone and then utilises an app to provide voice-to-voice, voice-to-text, photo and text translation to a huge variety of languages in almost, but not quite, real time. What's more, it's able to use an AI version of your own voice for audio playback in different languages.

item.title: YouTubers Are Making AI Slop for Babies
item.description: As if usual content for children isn't bad enough.

item.title: Spotify Wrapped’s genius marketing taps into individuality and belonging
item.description: Spotify Wrapped works because it nails the balance between competing needs: the desire to belong and the desire to stand out. Even before this year’s Spotify Wrapped dropped, I had a hunch what mine would reveal.
